Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Harpocrates with hair in side knot. Head only. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white coating. Red-brown Nile silt fabric. Broken at neck, body lost.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably made in Naukratis. Good parallels from Naukratis (Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA706; NA698; NA700; Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1896-1908-E.4691; AN1896-1908-E.4693). Roman parallel from early 3rd century AD Athribis (Tell Atrib, Szymańska 2005, no.65). Ptolemaic (Török 1995, no.69) and Roman parallels (Török 1995, Pl.41 no.69, 1st century AD; Bayeer Neimer 1988, Pl.11, no.58; Besques 1992, Pl.69 no.E369 from middle Egypt; Dunand 1990, no. 304 see also no.180, nos. 201, 288). Bayer-Niemeier, E. 1988. ‘Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik. Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann, 1. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten’. Melsungen. Besques, S. 1992. ‘Catalogue raisonné des figurines et reliefs en terre-cuite grecs, étrusques et romains, 4, 2. Epoques hellénistique et romaine. Cyrénaïque, Egypte ptolémaïque et romaine, Afrique du Nord et Proche-Orient’. Paris. Dunand, F. 1990. Catalogue des Terres cuites gréco-romaines d’Egypte. Musée du louvre. Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Paris. Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout. Török, L. 1995. ‘Hellenistic and Roman terracottas from Egypt’. Roma.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.094) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4592 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
